--- "Nagarajan, Naveen (Cognizant)" <nnaveen@c...> wrote:
> How are assertions enabled in Junit?
> To enable assertions in Jdk1.4,we use -ea flag .
> While using Junit which implicitly uses assertions, how
> are assertions implicitly enabled?

JUnit assertions aren't Java assertions.  They don't even use the 
same exception objects.

The methods in the 'junit.framework.Assert' class do comparisons, 
using Java 'if' statements, not Java 1.4 'assert' statements, and 
throw 'junit.framework.AssertionFailedError' instances (and 
sometimes 'junit.framework.ComparisonFailure' instances) when they 
find differences.

I don't know of any plans to "upgrade" JUnit to use the Java 
1.4 'assert' functionality.  (But then there are *A LOT* of things I 
don't know.  ;-)
